title: Download Notability for macOS and iOS
description: Boost note-taking with Notability — a flexible app combining handwriting, typing, sketches, and audio recording to help you organize ideas and stay productive anywhere. Developed for Apple users (iOS, macOS).
content:
Notability is a user-friendly note-taking software that enables a user to jot down any idea and organize data in the most effective way to achieve productivity through writing, drawing, and audio recording. Notability started as a hit on iPad, but now it is one of the essential applications used by learners, businesspeople, and artists who require a versatile space to keep their notes.

Users can choose to work in the mode they feel most comfortable in, as the app supports handwriting, typed text, and sketches seamlessly. typed documents, sketches, and notes. Be it in a lecture, in a meeting, or when brainstorming ideas, Notability provides you with the tools that allow you to record, review, and refine the ideas in the most effective ways possible.

Among the most remarkable features of Notability, it is possible to integrate handwritten notes with typed ones in the same document. It is easy to move between tools: typing, drawing, and highlighting. Audio recording also takes place in the app, in which users can record spoken material and match it with their typed notes. Later, by tapping on a word or a drawing, it will take you to the particular point on the recording.

This attribute comes in handy, especially when students need to go back to the lectures or when professionals need to go back to the meetings. Notability has a clean interface and easy-to-use controls that allow one to concentrate on the work without being distracted by anything.

Versatility is one of the primary motives to select Notability. No matter whether you prefer to write with a stylus, type, or use a mix of both, or you have a different note-taking style or a skill of taking notes, this app fits any note-taking style or task. When you want to draw the diagram, highlight the PDF, and create a list of things that must be done to accompany your notes, Notability has everything you need in a single interface. It is because of such flexibility that it becomes the more enjoyable option to have among people who not only want a digital notebook, but they want it to be creative, functional, and dynamic with the ideas that thrive in it. In addition to referencing abilities, another great strength of Notability is the ability to record audio. Notability is one of the few note-taking apps that incorporates audio seamlessly. You can use the time of writing or sketching to record lectures, meetings, or personal thoughts. You may then replay the audio files and follow the audio scan over your notes. This allows one to easily remember the background behind a certain argument or drawing. To the students, this implies that they never miss a vital piece of information. The professionals can use it as a sure method of going back to discussions and decisions made, rather than remembering them. Another bright feature of Notability is its management of documents. The app allows importing PDFs, images, and other files; thus, you can annotate and group them with your notes. It allows you to add dividers and subjects that help organize your notebooks in a way that fits your working process. Your notes also synchronize with your iCloud, meaning that your notes will always be on all your devices. The search option will enable you to locate the handwritten text, typed words, and even annotations in a snap, thus saving you time and aggravation.

What Are the Alternatives to Notability? Notability has a few alternatives that have their advantages. Nebo is an application that provides note-taking and revolves around handwriting recognition. It enables a user to write with a stylus, like writing on paper, and transforms handwritten notes into computer text. In addition to having math support and the ability to recognize diagrams, Nebo is a suitable app to take technical notes as well, and it can be used across several devices, such as Windows and Android, which makes its device compatibility greater than that of Notability. Another alternative is the Concepts, which will be more oriented towards creative thinking and designers. Even though note-taking features were also provided, its main advantages are more conventional: flexible drawing tools, an unlimited number of layers (canvases), and well-adjusted drawing instruments. This application is best suited to people who would like to combine notes with illustrations or design elements. The app allows drawing with layers and custom brushes and has many export options, which means it can be used by visual thinkers. Craft is a reference software app that is geared towards structure and collaboration. It enables students to produce nested documents, connect ideas with others, and collaborate on teams with people in real time. Craft can be used on Apple devices and the web; hence, it can be accessed over several platforms. Its clear, stripped-down design and emphasis on relationships among documents make it desirable to those who desire their notes to be as ordered as their minds.
summary: Notability is a user-friendly note-taking software that enables users to organize data in the most effective way possible. The app supports handwriting, typed text, and sketches seamlessly, allowing users to integrate handwritten notes with typed ones in the same document. It also allows users to record spoken material and match it with their typed notes. Notability's ability to record audio can be used to recall lectures, meetings, or personal thoughts. It has a clean interface and easy-to-use controls that allow users to concentrate on their work without distraction. Other features include a search option to locate handwritten text, typed words, and annotations in a snap, saving time and aggravation. Notable also allows for import PDFs, images, and other files, and group them with your notes.
shortSummary: Notability offers a user-friendly note-taking app with seamless integration, seamless document management, and audio recording, ideal for learners, businesspeople, and designers.

scraped_sources.text:
Concepts is an ideal tool for artists, architects, designers, and everyone who works with visuals, as the app offers a lot of drawing tools and options. You work on an infinite canvas and can choose from various brushes that are also sensitive to pressure and tilt, so the app mimics pen and paper drawing.
With Concepts, you can freely pan and zoom on your canvas and use precise rulers and various shape guides to create detailed illustrations, sketches, or plans. The app also has snapping and grid tools to keep your designs organized. You can work on various layers to add blend modes or opacity and have more control over your composition.
When you download Concepts, you can start using them right away. The app has an intuitive interface and supports multiple gestures for actions that you use repeatedly, like redo and undo, or zoom in and out. You can use Concepts with styluses, and the tool is available for free on iOS and Android mobile devices, as well as Windows computers.
Why should I download Concepts?
Even though Concepts can seem to be a regular sketching app, it’s a more powerful solution that gives you access to multiple tools and a flexible environment where you can easily create various designs. You make your work using an infinite canvas that allows you to freely organize your concepts, so that you can pan, zoom, and rotate your working area and keep everything in the same file.
Concepts is based on a vector engine, so every line and shape you draw is sharp, but you can also easily modify it later. You can change things like angles, path curves, or brush width at any point, not only when sketching. It’s a great solution if you need to create wireframes, architectural drawings, or precise illustrations for printing.
If you’re used to using a stylus, Concepts supports multiple different tools across different platforms, so you can use an Apple Pencil, Surface Pen, Samsung S Pen, and other tools to draw with. Concepts can detect the pressure you’re applying when creating your settings and adjust the lines accordingly; you can also select from a collection of realistic brushes that mimic the real-world counterparts like pencils, markers, airbrushes, or technical pens. You can quickly control things like colors, actions, width, or brush time by using the tool wheel and customizing it with the options you use the most.
When you download Concepts, you’ll discover it’s a great tool for freehand drawings as well as more structured projects. The app has various layout tools like precision grids, alignment guides, object snapping, and rulers, so it also works when you need to design an architectural blueprint or a technical illustration. You can also group your elements or work on layers to keep your content organized while keeping each part editable.
You can use Concepts with other people and collaborate with them in real time, enter a presentation mode to show your work to project stakeholders, or annotate the designs with feedback and notes. Concepts also lets you export your files to various file formats like PDF, PNG, SVG, and DXF, but you can keep the projects synced with the cloud storage and access your work this way. You can download Concepts for free on various platforms, but there are also various paid plans targeted at professionals and businesses.
Is Concepts free?
Yes, there’s a freemium version of Concepts that gives you access to different vector brushes, color wheels, an infinite canvas, creating up to five layers, all grid and paper types, and exporting to JPG.
If you need more, Concepts also comes in Pro and Teams editions, which unlock robust brush libraries and the ability to create custom ones, cross-platform syncs, infinite layers, export to a wider range of formats, and cloud backup, just to name a few of the main features.
What operating systems are compatible with Concepts?
In order to get the best experience out of Concepts, it’s recommended that you use it with a stylus either on your computer, tablet, or smartphone. You can download Concepts on iOS devices if you have version 14 or higher. Other smartphones and tablets need to have Android 8.0 or later. Concepts also has apps dedicated to Windows 10/11 computers and Chromebooks, and the tool is optimized for touchscreen laptops.
What are the alternatives to Concepts?
Nebo is a great note-taking app that can recognize handwriting to create editable text, equations, shapes, or diagrams. It’s widely used by students and has a free version that unlocks all basic features. If you need more, there’s also a Pro edition with unlimited notebooks, PDF import, as well as exporting to multiple formats. Nebo can sync your files with Dropbox and OneDrive, and you can download it on iOS, Android, and Windows devices.
Bamboo Paper is a solution offered by Wacom for iOS and Android tablets and smartphones, as well as Windows computers. The app mimics writing with pen and paper, and its free version provides basic brush types and paper types. With the paid options, you get access to a bigger library of different pens, brushes, and pencils, as well as infinite notebooks. It works well with different styluses and can recognize pressure to adjust the line style. It’s extremely popular with users of Wacom tablets and styluses.
Notewise is a great option for students, and it offers a lot of templates for academic needs, but also allows you to search through all your handwritten notes. You can draw and write on an infinite canvas, use different shapes, and annotate your files with sticky notes and comments. It allows exporting to various file formats, adding audio notes, and syncing your work to the cloud. Notewise comes in both free and paid versions and works perfectly with Apple Pencil and S-Pen, so it’s recommended to use it on iOS and Android tablets.

Nebo is an AI-powered application for writing handwritten notes that can then be converted into digital text and edited freely. With this tool, you can input your content with a stylus and enjoy a high level of accuracy and efficiency. It’s perfect if you’re a student, teacher, or just anyone else who takes a lot of notes that you then want to transform into searchable and editable documents.
With Nebo, you can write down text and mathematical equations and draw shapes, and the app will auto-recognize the words, symbols, or numbers. Because you’re writing with a stylus, the whole process feels natural, but you can then easily select, move, or resize your content to have a more precise format in your document.
It’s a very simple app where you just need to select the language you’re using, and most of its interface is the page canvas where you add your notes. Anyone who’s looking for a tool like this should download Nebo on their tablet or mobile device, but the app is also available on computers.
Why should I download Nebo?
When you use Nebo, you'll be able to use the canvas of the app as you like, and as you write with a stylus, all your words are converted in real-time into editable text. It’s not as much an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) tool as they usually process the documents in full after they are done; Nebo, on the other hand, recognizes what you’re writing live.
After you download Nebo, you’ll notice it also has a very interactive editing system where you get access to intuitive pen gestures, so it’s easier to resize, underline, or delete specific words. You can also draw rough shapes; the app will convert your sketches into proper diagrams. You can also add intelligent blocks to your canvas that support text, math, diagrams, and drawings. With them, you can write a paragraph of text, then draw a diagram, add a handwritten math formula, and edit each of those sections independently and fully.
When you write your text, you can select between 65 supported languages the app can detect and quickly switch to a different one if needed. It’s great when you’re working in a bilingual environment or want to translate your text later on. You can also type your text on a keyboard and handwrite it with a stylus, making Nebo an app that supports hybrid input. You can switch from one to another and include both types in your document. It is also possible to have both typed-out text and handwritten sketches or comments. You can also easily create diagrams, and Nebo Builder will intelligently recognize flowcharts, graphs, and visual connections.
When you add math formulas, you’ll notice that with Nebo, you can convert even the most complex equations into professional digital versions. You can also export them into the LaTeX format, which is used for academic, engineering, or scientific work.
You don’t need to have a constant internet connection to use Nebo, you can just sync your notebooks when you’re back online. It is possible to quickly export your documents into multiple formats (Word, PDF, plain text, or even HTML) and share them with others through your preferred method. Nebo also integrates with cloud storage services so you can connect platforms like Google Drive, Dropbox, and iCloud.
Is Nebo free?
You can download Nebo and use its free version, but it is very limited in usage, so you can only create one notebook. You, of course, get access to all the basics like writing with a stylus, converting handwriting into digital text, and exporting into the basic formats, but the Pro paid version gives you access to all of its features.
With the Pro version, you get access to unlimited notebooks, PDF imports, advanced exports into HTML, PDF, or LaTeX, better diagram and math recognition, as well as the option to sync your files to the cloud and share them between devices.
Another thing that’s worth mentioning is that you need a separate license for each platform you’re using Nebo on, which is an unusual licensing format.
What operating systems are compatible with Nebo?
Because Nebo is optimized for writing with styluses, you can download it on iPhones or iPads with iOS version 13 or later, and the app works great with Apple Pencil.
If you have an Android smartphone or tablet, you need at least Android 8.0. The app permits the use of the Samsung S Pen, Huawei M-Pen, and other active styluses with it.
You can also download Nebo on Windows 10 or 11, but it’s best to use it on Microsoft Surface devices.
At the moment, there’s no version for macOS computers.
What are the alternatives to Nebo?
Concepts is an app for Android, iOS, and Windows that gives you an infinite canvas you can use not only for taking notes but also for drawing various designs. It’s not an app that is geared toward structured note-taking, but you can also use it for this purpose. It comes in both free and paid versions, where the latter gives you access to unlimited layers, custom brushes, and professional-grade export formats.
Another option is Bamboo Paper, which is developed by Wacom and, as such, works great with their styluses and tablets. You can get it on iOS, Android, and Windows, and it does a great way to mimic the feel of writing on actual paper thanks to its digital pen technology. The app is mostly free, but if you want, you can expand its nationalities by purchasing Tool Packs. You can also create a free Inkspace account to share your content between devices.
If you’re looking for something else geared towards notes, then Notewise is a great app. You can write down notes with styluses, annotate PDF files, or use them for a variety of purposes. You can create and edit your notes by using tools such as lasso selection, highlighter, and different pen types, but you can also link elements with each other or even add audio notes. Notewise is available as a free and paid app on Android tablets and iPads.

argos_summary: Notability is a versatile note-taking app that allows users to combine handwriting, typed text, and sketches, making it popular among students, professionals, and creatives. It features seamless audio recording that syncs with notes, enabling users to revisit lectures or meetings easily. The app also supports document management, allowing users to import and annotate PDFs, and offers synchronization with iCloud for easy access across devices. Alternatives to Notability include Nebo, which focuses on handwriting recognition, and Concepts, which is tailored for visual thinkers and designers.
